data: All were silent, Tyrians and Trojans; I mean all who were watching the show were hanging on the lips of the interpreter of its wonders, when drums and trumpets were heard to sound inside it and cannon to go off.
The History of Don Quixote, Volume 2, Part 27
Cervantes Saavedra, Miguel de, 1547-1616; Dor√©, Gustave, 1832-1883 [Illustrator]; Ormsby, John, 1829-1895 [Translator]
